name: Om Ali
author: NANCY GIRGIS
summary: This Egyptian dessert contains phyllo dough or puff pastry, milk and nuts. Use any kind of nuts that you would like and eat it with a spoon. Legend has it that Om Ali was the first wife of the sultan Ezz El Din Aybek. When the sultan died, his second wife had a dispute with Om Ali, resulting in the second wife's death. To celebrate, Om Ali made this dessert and distributed it among the people of the land.
ingredients: 1 (17.5 ounce) package frozen puff pastry sheets, thawed
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Place the pastry sheets in the baking dish and place the dish in the oven
When the top layer  turns crunchy and golden, remove it from the oven
Continue until all the sheets are cooked
In a bowl, combine walnuts, pecans, hazelnuts, raisins, coconut and 1/4 cup sugar
Break cooked pastry into pieces and stir into nut mixture
Bring milk and 1/2 cup sugar to a boil in a medium saucepan over medium heat
Beat the heavy cream with the remaining 1/2 cup sugar until stiff peaks form
Spread evenly over nut mixture in dish
Place dessert under oven broiler until top is golden brown, about 10 minutes
